title: The Sequel
description: The Gospels record Jesus life and ministry. Acts is the continuation, the sequel, of Jesus ministry carried on by the Holy Spirit and His disciples. And Jesus ministry continues today through the Holy Spirit and the Church as we are called to be Jesus' witnesses.

title: Jesus and Two Women
description: Jesus crossed all barriers to share the gospel, and we who follow Him must do no less.

title: Telling Stories
description: Same seed. Four different soils. Four different responses. Which one describes you?

title: Unconventional
description: Being instead of doing. Resting instead of rushing. Unconventional? Yes. But it is a necessary thing for a follower of Jesus to put into practice.

title: Transfiguration
description: God gives a vital command from an incredible moment high on a mountain.

title: Miracles
description: Miracles are never meant to be ends in and of themselves. Miracles are meant to point beyond themselves to the Miracle Worker.

title: The Best Sermon Ever
description: God's kingdom turns things upside down and is already, but not yet.

title: Wilderness
description: Jesus' weird cousin: the mission and baptism

title: Homecoming
description: The biblical way to build a wall in just 52 days.

title: Tears
description: God is true to His Word.

title: Disappointed with Life
description: Guest speaker Jason Standfield shares that even when life isn't what we expected God is still present and working.

title: Reformation
description: A story of a treasure discovered and lived out.

title: The Tale of Two Kings
description: Who or what do you place your trust in?

title: Holy, Holy, Holy
description: Guest speaker Eric shares on the call of Isaiah the Prophet as he encounters the Holy God.

title: Unfaithful
description: Sin does not merely break God's law; it breaks His heart.

title: The Fish Story
description: There is a huge difference between man's fish stories and God's; and it's more than the size of the fish!

title: A Farmer and a Plumb Line
description: Comparison cannot be our measure; we've got to use God's Plumb Line.

title: Passing the Torch
description: No one person can solely accomplish the task of sharing Christ with the entire world. The torch must be passed and received. Again and again.

title: Just a Regular Guy
description: God's not looking for a few good men; He's looking for one willing person. Just a regular, ordinary person who will allow Him to work through him or her to accomplish His plan.

title: Divided Kingdom
description: This cautionary account reveals how complacency leads to compromise and compromise can lead to destruction, affecting not only the individual but also generations to come.

title: The One Before You
description: Guests Pastors Paul and Robyn Kramer, missionaries to Thailand, share the importance of sharing Christ with the one God has put before you.

title: Resurrection
description: The same power that raised Jesus from the grave is in us!

title: The Last Night
description: In living Christ taught us how to die; in dying Christ taught us how to live.

title: One Week to Live
description: Jesus' Triumphant Entrance announced that He is King of kings.

title: City on a Hill
description: Five take a-ways from a building project of mammoth proportions!

title: The Scarlet Thread
description: The Story of God is like a scarlet thread running through time. And your story is a part of His big story!

title: A Man After God's Own Heart
description: Man looks at the outward appearance, but God looks at the heart.

title: First King
description: Lessons we can learn from a life that careened off course.

title: A Pagan Widow Gets It Right
description: A story of God's provision, providence, and redemption.

title: The Time of God's Patience
description: What can we learn from the crazy cycle in Judges?

title: Conquest
description: Are you in a difficult season or situation? Strength and courage is available.

title: Promised Land
description: What we believe shapes what we see.

title: Real Freedeom
description: God does not give us the Law as a condition for relationship; the Law is a confirmation of a relationship.

title: Birth of a Nation
description: Moses was a man God used in a powerful way to deliver His people, but he offered numerous excuses initially as to why he was not the one for the job. You might be surprised at how familiar those excuses are.

title: Why the Bible
description: Ever been questioned about why you believe the Bible? Ever waver in response? Here are some simple truths to help you stand firm.

title: Promise of a Nation
description: Redemption through a promise is not us making a promise to God, but rather us believing God's promise to us by faith.

title: WARNING
description: Heeding warnings can be so hard, even if we know that it is for our benefit. Here's some practical insight to stay strong when tempted.

title: The First Story
description: The creation account is more about the Who and the why than the what and the how.

title: My New Year's Prayer for You
description: Pastor Lisa shares her New Year's prayer for the church.

title: The Purpose of Christmas, a Time for Reconciliation
description: We all have conflict in our lives! What we need is reconciliation.

title: The Purpose of Christmas, a Time for Salvation
description: God had a plan and gift with you in mind before time even began.

title: The Purpose of Christmas, a Time for Celebration
description: Guest Speaker Eric challenges us to take some time this Christmas season to re-evaluate our Christmas traditions and to consider how we can use them to honor God in our celebration.

title: The Wonder-filled Good News
description: An introduction to our Christmas series: The Purpose of Christmas. Jesus fulfilled hundred's of prophecies foretold by the prophets, some of them in his birth.

title: The Way of Thanks-living
description: We cannot forget. Too much is at stake.

title: Perfect Peace, Is it Possible
description: We apologize for the technical difficulty that you will encounter 23:07 into this message. When you get to that point please forward it to 24:46 to finish listening to Perfect Peace, Is it Possible.

title: God has done great things for us
description: May the great things God has done for us propel us to sow seeds of the gospel.

title: The BIG Confession
description: Is sin that big of a deal?  We explore eight truths, though not exhaustive, from Psalm 51 to gain insight.

title: How Can I Keep from Singing?
description: With all who God is and for all that He has done praising Him is a glorious privilege.

title: Who is the Holy Spirit?
description: Brad Hunt, missionary to pastors in India, shares who the Holy Spirit is.

title: Going in a circle doesn't mean that you're not going anywhere.
description: Each step, each time is an opportunity to grow, experience God, and become more fully devoted to God.

title: The Big Reveal
description: God has revealed Himself through Creation, Scripture, and Jesus Christ and our response is glorify Him.

title: Joy, In a Sweet-smelling Sacrifice
description: Jelly-filled donuts interrupted this message. We encourage you to grab a jelly-filled donut prior to listening to this two-part message for the full effect!

title: Joy, In a Sweet-smelling Sacrifice, Part 2
description: Jelly-filled donuts interrupted this message. This is the continuation. We encourage you to grab a jelly-filled donut prior to listening to the two-part message for the full effect!

title: Involvement Required
description: A good question for all of us to answer: What do I have?

title: Joy, In True Contentment
description: Experiencing True Contentment is possible even in a world that breeds discontentment.

title: Joy, Through Right Thinking
description: Our citizenship makes a difference in how we think!

title: Joy, In Running the Race
description: Can you really put joy and running in the same sentence?

title: Joy, In Service
description: Guest speaker Eric shares an engaging messsage of how his simple faith morphed into faith with works and how that has brought him joy in serving alongside the Spirit of God.

title: Joy, Confidence Redirected
description: There is joy when our confidence is redirected, not placing it in our abilities, accomplishments, health, or wealth but in Christ alone.

title: Joy, Laboring Together
description: Are we cultivating the same qualities that led the Apostle Paul to commend Timothy and Epaphroditus for displaying qualities as they experienced joy in laboring together to accomplish the goal of Christ being known?

title: Joy, Illuminated
description: As followers of Jesus, we not only have the responsibility, but also have the privilege of being a bearer of the Light of Christ through the power of the Holy Spirit.

title: Joy, in Humble Service
description: As we clothe ourselves with the same attitude of Christ, we will experience joy in humble service.

title: Joy, In Suffering
description: We can choose to allow our suffering to become an obstacle, or we can use it as an opportunity--an opportunity to make Christ, the Source of our joy, known.

title: Joy, Ever-Increasing Love
description: As ever-increasing love in real knowledge and all discernment grows and expands, it produces the fruit of righteousness in a believer's life.

title: Joy, Overflowing Generosity
description: Joy produces overflowing generosity in a maturing Christians life.

title: Joy, An Introduction
description: We being a summer road trip through Philippians, a book filled with JOY!

title: Father, a Vital Role
description: An encouraging word for Dads as they have a vital role to fulfill in their child's life.

title: Stand Guard
description: Nehemiah led the Israelites to rebuild the wall around Jerusalem, completing what laid in ruins for a century and a half in just 52 days. Nehemiah modeled a heart for the people, a heart for their God, and a heart for the work. Encouraging everyone to contribute to the work and to trust that God would fight for them when opposition escalated. Some worked. Some stood guard.

title: Appropriate Attire
description: God provides followers of Jesus appropriate attire for the real, but invisible, spiritual war.

title: Expect Opposition, Whisper with a Hiss
description: Resisting the enemy through awareness of his tactics.

title: Expect Oppostion: What's in a name?
description: Knowing our enemy is one of the most important things before heading into battle.

title: More Precious than Rubies
description: Honoring our Ladies on Mother's Day

title: Finding Your Place
description: No one can do everything, but everyone can do something. Finding your place and serving shoulder to shoulder.

title: All In!
description: A message of trusting in the Covenant Keeping God

title: Credibly Incredible
description: There is much credible evidence that Jesus died and yet rose from the dead!

title: Let's Not Take Our Humanness Lightly
